title: Fenestra NV True White Lot 4 White (California)
description: A flinty aroma, racy texture and delicate apple and white-peach flavors make this light-bodied wine seem agile like a dancer. It has great balance and a welcome refreshing quality.

title: Lucien Albrecht 2015 Cuvée Romanus Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: Upfront, juicy green and yellow pear shot through with citrus makes this an easy-drinking, fruit-driven and appetizing white. Slightly bitter notes of pith counterpoint the fruitiness and lead to a rounded, off-dry finish.

title: Lucien Albrecht 2015 Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Gentle notes of Damask rose seem to frame the generous, juicy peach fruit of this wine. The off-dry palate does not diminish this perfumed expression and instead boosts the fruit notes even more. Pithy grapefruit bitterness provides a welcome counterbalance. The finish is appetizing and aromatic.

title: Lunadoro 2014 Primosenso  (Rosso di Montepulciano)
description: Made with 100% Sangiovese, this opens with aromas that recall red berry and blue flower. The smooth, fresh palate offers juicy strawberry, cinnamon and a white pepper note alongside bright acidity and silky tannins.

title: Mirabelle NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (California)
description: This is a traditional-style wine with a light salmon color, lively cherry and lychee aromas and crisp, white-peach and apricot flavors. It wraps a lot of flavor in an elegant package and is substantive enough to drink through a meal.

title: Miro 2014 Alegria Vineyard Old Vines Reserve Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Made with 20% Alicante Bouschet, this old-vine wine is perfumed in spearmint and dill, nicely balanced in its approach, allowing juicy blackberry and cherry to speak. A soft texture makes it pleasant on the palate, dotted in comforting waves of leather and coffee.

title: Mommessin 2013 Domaine de Champ de Cour  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: Rich, dense and concentrated this is a ready-to-drink structured wine. It has blackberry fruits along with acidity and a touch of pepper. The tannins are firm, sustaining the wine so that it can age further. Drink now and until 2020.

title: Joullian 2014 Roger Rose Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)
description: Intriguing aromas of lime zest and warm butter are enhanced by slightly botanical aromas of cut chives, kiwi and more green fruit. The palate is laced with easy flavors of apple, sea salt, dried peach and lime rind.

title: Rock Wall 2014 Rock Hound Red (California)
description: Rich blackberry and chocolate flavors, rounded tannins, good concentration and a velvety mouthfeel add up to a lot of pleasure in this full-bodied wine blended from Zinfandel and Cabernet Sauvignon.

title: Otazu 2015 Chardonnay (Navarra)
description: Dry, wooly aromas of apple and peach pit are steady. Pithy nectarine and apple flavors veer towards citrus on a mild, focused finish.

title: Owen Roe 2014 DuBrul Vineyard Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)
description: The aromas of stone fruit, spice and toast show nuance and detail. The palate is restrained, showing a beautiful sense of balance to the elegant lemony flavors.

title: Tenor 2014 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of melted butter, vanilla, stone fruit and baking spices lead to full-bodied peach flavors. The palate brings a creamy feel and lemony flavors on the finish.

title: Tenshen 2015 White (Central Coast)
description: This cleverly named wine by Joey Tensley and Alex Guarachi indeed packs tension into the nose, with fairly ripe peach, creamy apple and tropical-fruit aromas cut back by clean and steely restraint. The palate shows apple custard, mango and banana tones set against a grippy structure.

title: Muga 2015 Rosé (Rioja)
description: Crisp, focused aromas of citrus peel set up a firm, crystalline palate with a touch of body. Dry, fresh citrusy flavors end with chalky grip and a note of fresh-ground white pepper.

title: Pomum 2013 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (43%), Cabernet Franc (23%), Merlot (17%), Malbec (9%) and Petit Verdot. Aromas of coffee, green herb, flowers and red fruit are followed by a full-flavored palate that provides a lot of appeal.

title: Proulx 2015 Willow Creek Farm Rose of Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: A nice salmon color, this subtle kitchen-sink pink blend of 77% Grenache, 8% Mission, 4% Petite Sirah, 4% Syrah, 4% Zinfandel, 1% Cabernet Sauvignon, 1% Merlot and 1% Petit Verdot offers clove, raspberry and light plum on the nose. The palate offers more raspberry, a touch of bubblegum and a concrete-driven mineral tension that makes for excellent texture.

title: Seacampo 2012 Touriga Nacional (Dão)
description: Lightly wood aged, this pure Touriga Nacional wine brings out the structure of the grape and the minerality of the region. It is rich, firmly textured with dark tannins as well as black currant fruits. The wine is ripe and ready to drink.

title: Tempus Cellars 2012 Sagemoor Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This 100% varietal wine displays aromas of herb, leaf, cocoa, barrel spice and currant. The flavors are light and fresh, showing restraint and a pleasing mouthfeel. The finish lingers.

title: Tempus Cellars 2013 Grenache (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine shows a unique aroma profile of sweet herb, apricot and red plum, along with a kiss of vanilla bean. The flavors are light and elegant, showing subtlety and restraint along with a pleasing sense of purity.

title: North by Northwest 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Herb, cherry, wood spice and vanilla aromas are followed by cherry and blackberry flavors backed by a squeeze of dry tannins. There are good things going on but the oak gets a bit up front.

title: Wölffer 2013 Coeur Cheval Petit Verdot (Long Island)
description: Bold swathes of bramble, toast and smoke reverberate throughout this inky rich red. While lusciously concentrated, it's not at all brawny with tart red-currant acidity and fine-grained tannins lending a four-square frame of structure. The finish is penetrating and quite long.

title: Llopart 2011 Gran Reserva Imperial Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Apple and clover aromas are mild but attractive. The palate feels plump, with modest acidity. Yeasty, toasty flavors of apple, peach and melon finish with a mix of spice, yeast and dusty notes. Drink this warm-vintage brut Cava now.

title: Greek Wine Cellars 2015 Moschofilero (Peloponnese)
description: Citrus, peach and rose aromas start this refined white. On the palate, it's a balance of tropical fruit, herbs and a clean, saline finish. Crisp but full of character, this is a very good and versatile white for the table.

title: Herdade do Esporão 2014 Quatro Castas Red (Alentejano)
description: This is a concentrated blend of local grapes. The Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon give it a rich texture. It is a complex balance of tannins, spice and ripe blackberry fruits. The acidity and tight aftertaste suggest it is still young. Drink from 2017.

title: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2015 Tradition Riesling (Alsace)
description: Generous, brown-sugar-crusted apples lead to a fruit-driven, appetizing and balanced palate. Apple and orange dominate with a touch of lemon brightness. Drink this juicy and lively wine soon.
winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

title: Hosmer 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Cayuga Lake)
description: Pretty white-flower, lemon and lime notes waft from the glass of this dry light-bodied Sauvignon Blanc. It's vibrantly fruity, full of fresh pineapple and nectarine flavors accented by a swathe of green herb and bramble. The finish is refreshing, crisp and mineral. Drink now through 2019.

title: Inspire Moore 2015 Joy Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Cascades of fresh white grapefruit and pineapple take center stage in this invigorating dry Riesling. Nimble-footed and delicate in texture, it extends long on a rippling mineral undertone. Drink now through 2020.

title: Kingston Family 2014 CJ's Barrel Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)
description: Red-fruit aromas of raspberry and plum come with a note of catmint. Fresh, snappy and true to the variety on the palate, this tastes of plum, tomato, herbs and barrel spice. A lean, fresh finish closes things out. Compared to prior years, this seems leaner and lighter in body.

title: Koenig 2014 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Ripe notes of Mirabelle plums rise from the glass. The palate casts the aromatic richness of floral stone fruit against the citric freshness. Hints of honeysuckle and apricot play about this elegant, restrained and balanced wine.

title: Tsantali 2015 Kanenas Rosé (Greece)
description: This rosé starts with scents of anise, pepper and spice, followed by an earthy array of spice and cranberry and cherry flavors. Exotic but refined, the wine will pair well with aged cheeses and beef.
